clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Safety and Efficacy Of Ertugliflozin (PF-04971729, MK-8835) In Participants With Type 2 Diabetes And Hypertension (MK-8835-042)
clinical_study.official_title: A 4-Week, Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Dose-Ranging, Parallel Group Study To Evaluate The Safety, Tolerability And Efficacy Of Once Daily PF-04971729 And Hydrochlorothiazide In Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus With Inadequate Glycemic And Blood Pressure Control

brief_summary.textblock: MK-8835-042 (B1521004) is designed to assess the safety and efficacy of an investigational drug, ertugliflozin (MK-8835, PF-04971729), in participants with type 2 diabetes and hypertension. Participants in the study will receive 1 of 5 treatments for 28 days (either placebo, 1 of 3 doses of ertugliflozin [1, 5, or 25 mg], or the approved drug hydrochlorothiazide [HCTZ]). The primary hypothesis of the study was that ertugliflozin was superior to placebo on the change from baseline in average, 24-hour systolic blood pressure (SBP) on Day 28.

primary_outcome.description: Baseline 24-hour average SBP was assessed using 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure monitoring (ABPM).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on 24-hour Average SBP at Week 4
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on 24-hour average SBP at Week 4 assessed using 24-hour ABPM. In the case of missing data, last observation carried forward (LOCF).

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Average Daytime and Nighttime SBP
secondary_outcome.description: Daytime was defined as 0600 to 2159 hours, inclusive, local time. Nighttime was defined as 2200 to 0559 hours, inclusive, local time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on Daytime Average SBP at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on daytime average SBP at Week 4 using 24 hour ABPM. In the case of missing data, LOCF. Daytime was defined as 0600 to 2159 hours, inclusive, local time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on Nighttime Average SBP at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on nighttime average SBP at Week 4 using 24 hour ABPM. In the case of missing data, LOCF. Nighttime was defined as 2200 to 0559 hours, inclusive, local time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Seated, Triplicate Trough SBP
secondary_outcome.description: Trough SBP was measured using an automated blood pressure device with the participant in a seated position for at least 5 minutes before and while the blood pressure measure is obtained. Three measurements of blood pressure were taken at least 2-minutes apart. Baseline trough SBP is calculated as the mean of triplicate (3) trough SBP measures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Seated, Triplicate Trough SBP at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Trough SBP was measured using an automated blood pressure device with the participant in a seated position for at least 5 minutes before and while the blood pressure measure is obtained. Three measurements of blood pressure were taken at least 2-minutes apart. The change from baseline at Week 4 is the difference between the baseline and Week 4 assessments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline 24-hour, Daytime and Nightime Average Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP)
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline 24-hour average DBP was assessed using 24-hour ABPM. Daytime was defined as 0600 to 2159 hours, inclusive, local time. Nighttime was defined as 2200 to 0559 hours, inclusive, local time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on 24-hour Average DBP at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on 24-hour average DBP at Week 4 using 24 hour ABPM. In the case of missing data, LOCF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on Daytime Average DBP at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on daytime average DBP at Week 4 using 24 hour ABPM. In the case of missing data, LOCF. Daytime was defined as 0600 to 2159 hours, inclusive, local time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on Nighttime Average DBP at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on nighttime average DBP at Week 4 using 24 hour ABPM. In the case of missing data, LOCF. Nighttime was defined as 2200 to 0559 hours, inclusive, local time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Seated, Triplicate Trough DBP
secondary_outcome.description: Trough DBP was measured using an automated blood pressure device with the participant in a seated position for at least 5 minutes before and while the blood pressure measure is obtained. Three measurements of blood pressure were taken at least 2-minutes apart. Baseline trough DBP is calculated as the mean of triplicate (3) trough DBP measures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Seated, Triplicate Trough DBP at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Trough DBP was measured using an automated blood pressure device with the participant in a seated position for at least 5 minutes before and while the blood pressure measure is obtained. Three measurements of blood pressure were taken at least 2-minutes apart. The change from baseline at Week 4 is the difference between the baseline and Week 4 assessments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline 24-hour, Daytime and Nightime Average Heart Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline 24-hour average heart rate was assessed using 24-hour ABPM. Daytime was defined as 0600 to 2159 hours, inclusive, local time. Nighttime was defined as 2200 to 0559 hours, inclusive, local time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on 24-hour Average Heart Rate at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in 24-hour average heart rate at Week 4 using 24 hour ABPM.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on Daytime Average Heart Rate at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in daytime average heart rate at Week 4 using 24 hour ABPM. In the case of missing data, LOCF. Daytime was defined as 0600 to 2159 hours, inclusive, local time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on Nighttime Average Heart Rate at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in 24-hour nighttime average heart rate at Week 4 using 24 hour ABPM. In the case of missing data, LOCF. Nighttime was defined as 2200 to 0559 hours, inclusive, local time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Seated, Triplicate Trough Heart Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Trough heart rate was measured using an automated blood pressure device with the participant in a seated position for at least 5 minutes before and while the heart rate measure was obtained. Three measurements of heart rate were taken at least 2-minutes apart. Baseline trough heart rate is calculated as the mean of triplicate (3) trough heart rate measures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Seated, Triplicate Trough Heart Rate at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Trough heart rate was measured using an automated blood pressure device with the participant in a seated position for at least 5 minutes before and while the heart rate measure was obtained. Three measurements of heart rate were taken at least 2-minutes apart. The change from baseline at Week 4 is the difference between the baseline and Week 4 assessments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline 24-hour Average Urinary Glucose Excretion
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary glucose excetion was corrected for a duration of 24 hours (with appropriate duration of collection defined as >20 hours and <28 hours).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on 24-hour Urinary Glucose Excretion at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary glucose excetion was corrected for a duration of 24 hours (with appropriate duration of collection defined as >20 hours and <28 hours). In the case of missing data, LOCF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
secondary_outcome.description: For FPG, blood was drawn after an overnight fast of at least 8 hours (except water).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FPG at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: For FPG, blood was drawn after an overnight fast of at least 8 hours (except water).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FPG at Week 2
secondary_outcome.description: For FPG, blood was drawn after an overnight fast of at least 8 hours (except water).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced an Adverse Event (AE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 63 days (including run-in, treatment period, and follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation participant administered a product or medical device; the event need not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment or usage. The table below includes all data collected since first dose of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Discontinued Study Drug Due to an AE
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation participant administered a product or medical device; the event need not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment or usage. The table below includes all data collected since first dose of study drug. Discontinuation of study drug due to an AE includes temporary and permanent discontinuation of study drug due to an AE.

Ertugliflozin tablet 1 mg once daily for 28 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with type 2 diabetes and hypertension
- Medically stable
- On at least 1 (and up to 2) oral diabetes drugs
- And up to 2 medicines for blood pressure control
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with type 1 diabetes
- Heart attack
- Stroke
- Uncontrolled blood pressure
- Significant kidney disease

results_reference.citation: Amin NB, Wang X, Mitchell JR, Lee DS, Nucci G, Rusnak JM. Blood pressure-lowering effect of the sodium glucose co-transporter-2 inhibitor ertugliflozin, assessed via ambulatory blood pressure monitoring in patients with type 2 diabetes and hypertension. Diabetes Obes Metab. 2015 Aug;17(8):805-8. doi: 10.1111/dom.12486. Epub 2015 Jun 17.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Prior to randomization, 194 participants received placebo for at least 3 weeks (completed the run-in period). Treated participants included all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

With treatment, visit, and treatment-by-visit interaction as fixed effects, participant as random effect and baseline FPG as the covariate.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced an Adverse Event (AE)
outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation participant administered a product or medical device; the event need not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment or usage. The table below includes all data collected since first dose of study drug.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 63 days (including run-in, treatment period, and follow-up)
outcome.population: Analysis population consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation participant administered a product or medical device; the event need not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment or usage. The table below includes all data collected since first dose of study drug. Discontinuation of study drug due to an AE includes temporary and permanent discontinuation of study drug due to an AE.

reported_events.desc: Serious adverse events include all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug except for the pre-randomization arm that includes all randomized participants. Non-serious adverse events include all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug (all arms).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Investigator will provide manuscripts, abstracts, or the full text of any other intended disclosure (poster presentation, invited speaker or guest lecturer presentation, etc.) to the sponsor at least 30 days before they are submitted for publication or otherwise disclosed. If any patent action is required to protect intellectual property rights, Investigator agrees to delay the disclosure for a period not to exceed an additional 60 days.
